framework Package¶

config Module¶

Module to handle config values. Config is defined at config.yaml.

class framework.config.Config[source]¶

Class to handle config. All methods are class methods.

classmethod base_url()[source]¶

Determine base URL from WebPy application values.

TODO: This assumes http, should support https. Maybe just make it configurable.

@rtype: string @returns: Calculated base URL or None if lib from web is not available.

data¶

Data to hold config values

classmethod dev()[source]¶

Get value of ‘dev’ configuration

@rtype: bool @returns: The value of dev

classmethod get(key)[source]¶

Get specific configuration value

@type key: string @param key: Index of item.

@rtype: * @returns: The value of the configuration item.

classmethod get_all()[source]¶

Get all values

@rtype: dict @returns: The full dictionary of configuration values

classmethod load()[source]¶

Load config. Reads config file and loads into data property. This assumes that the config file (config.yaml) is either in the current directory or one directory above it.

get_gettext_translation(locale_id)¶

Returns the translation object for the specified locale.

get_i18n_dir()¶

Return the path to the directory with the locale files

get_language()¶

Gets the language that has been set by the user, first checking the querystring and then the session. The session variable is set before the value is returned.

get_supported_languages()¶

Find the language files available in the translations directory. Returns a dictionary which has language codes as keys, and human-readable language names as values.

emailer Module¶

Emailing utility. Emailing is ultimately handled through webpy.

class framework.emailer.Emailer[source]¶

Email class for handling emailing for the application.

classmethod render(template_name, template_values=None, suffix='html')[source]¶

Render an email template, given values. Uses the jinja engine. Assumes templates are in a templates directory one above current.

classmethod send(addresses, subject, text, html=None, attachment=None, from_name=None, from_address=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Send email to recipients.

classmethod send_from_template(addresses, subject, template_name, template_values=None, attachment=None, from_name=None, from_address=None, **kwags)[source]¶

Create HTML and text emails from template, then send.

file_server Module¶

class framework.file_server.FileServer[source]¶

Bases: object

A generic FileServer.

add(data, filename=None, make_unique=False, max_size=None, grayscale=False, mirror=True, thumb_max_size=None)[source]¶

Add a file to the fileserver. If either adding the database record for the file or saving the file fails, then add will return None, and no modification will be made. Otherwise, the ID of the record in the database will be returned.

addDbRecord(db, filename)[source]¶

Insert a new record for a file into the given database.

Arguments: db – A web.py database (web.db) object app – The name of the app (str)

getUniqueFilename(filename)¶

Get a unique name for the file.

removeDbRecord(db, id)[source]¶
saveFile(fileid, data, **kwargs)[source]¶

Save the data into a file. Return True is file successfully saved, otherwise False.

Override this method to save files in other places.

Attributes: fileid – The id from the database record that corresponds to this file data – The data (string of bytes) contained in the file

class framework.file_server.S3FileServer(db)[source]¶

Bases: framework.file_server.FileServer

In order to use this FileServer, make sure that you have the aws section filled out in your conf.yaml file:

aws:
access_key_id: ‘<ACCESS_KEY>’ secret_access_key: ‘<SECRET_KEY>’ bucket: ‘<BUCKET_NAME>’
getConfigVar(var_name)[source]¶
getLocalPath(fileid)[source]¶

Get the path to the file given by the fileid on the local file system. This is used only to temporarily save the file before uploading it to the S3 server.

getS3Path(fileid)[source]¶

Get the path to the file given by the fileid on the S3 server.

getUniqueFilename(filename)¶

Get a unique name for the file.

saveFile(filename, data, mirror=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Save the data into a file. Return True is file successfully saved, otherwise False.

Attributes: filename – The id from the database record that corresponds to the file data – The data (string of bytes) contained in the file

saveTemporaryLocalFile(path, data)[source]¶

Save the file on the local file system. This is used only to temporarily save the file before uploading it to the S3 server. Creates directory if needed.

classmethod path(app, id)[source]¶

Path creates the path for an uploaded image. Given the app name and the ID of the image, it will put it in the folder: data/APP_NAME/images/FIRST_DIGIT_OF_ID/ID.png

session_holder Module¶

Simple module to handle persistent sessions.

class framework.session_holder.SessionHolder[source]¶

Singleton allows the session object to be passed between classes. Putting it here means we wont lose it if webpy reloads controller classes.

classmethod get_session()[source]¶

Get current session value.

@rtype: ?? @returns: The current session data.

session¶

Persistent session property.

classmethod set(_session)[source]¶

Set session value.

@type _session: ?? @param _session: Session data to set.

@rtype: ?? @returns: The current session data.

task_manager Module¶

Module to handle queue for tasks using beasnstalkd.

class framework.task_manager.Task(func, args)[source]¶

Class to contain a single task.

execute()[source]¶

Execute task.

class framework.task_manager.Tasks[source]¶

Class to manage tasks.

add(tube=None, func=None, data=None, timeout=120)[source]¶

Add a task to queue and use specific tube if provided.

process(handler=None, tube=None)[source]¶

Process queue. This should not be called from within a web app.

util Module¶

framework.util.add_leading_slash(s)[source]¶

Prefix the given string with a leading forward slash if it does not already exist.

framework.util.br2nl(s)[source]¶
Convert all <br /> tags to newlines (

).

framework.util.check_bad_words(data)[source]¶

Check input against a bad words list

framework.util.cleanUSPhone(phone)[source]¶

Clean up US phone numbers by stripping the leading 1 and any non-numerics.

framework.util.confirm_pid(run_folder)[source]¶

TBD

framework.util.deobfuscate(token)[source]¶

Base 64 decodes the given string and returns the leading digits of the decoded string.

framework.util.depunctuate(s, exclude=None, replacement='')[source]¶

Strips out all of the punctuation of the given string, excluding any punctuation included in the exclude argument list. Punctuation is replaced by a blank string or the given replacement argument.

framework.util.dictsort(dict_list, sort_by_me)[source]¶

Takes a list of dicts and returns that list sorted by the property given in the sort_by_me argument.

framework.util.filesizeformat(bytes)[source]¶

Format the value like a ‘human-readable’ file size (i.e. 13 KB, 4.1 MB, 102 bytes, etc).

framework.util.flatten(l, ltypes=(<type 'list'>, <type 'tuple'>))[source]¶

Flatten a list of lists into a single list. Not as cool as ruby’s flatten, but it works Thanks to: http://rightfootin.blogspot.com/2006/09/more-on-python-flatten.html

framework.util.format_time(seconds)[source]¶

Converts the given seconds into a human readable string.

framework.util.getBit(i, index)[source]¶
framework.util.get_fake_session(controller)[source]¶

Get the session manually (like from a request variable) instead of a cookie. Flash cant consistently get cookie data.

framework.util.get_flash_upload(web)[source]¶

Reformat data coming in from Flash FileReference FileReference has silly boundary problems that create bad timeout errors As standard multipart form data is present, this also works fine with standard HTML forms http://www.mail-archive.com/webpy@googlegroups.com/msg04505.html

framework.util.get_post_data(web)[source]¶

Get either web.input[‘file’] (HTML multipart form) or web.data() (octet upload) This is useful when a controller needs to accept data from both an HTML and a Flash post (URLLoader, not FileReference)

framework.util.good_decimal(num)[source]¶

Rounds a number to the nearest two decimal places.

framework.util.list_to_str(tags)[source]¶

Convert a list of tags into a delimited string.

framework.util.local_utcoffset(localtime=datetime.datetime(2011, 8, 23, 17, 0, 53, 523129), utctime=datetime.datetime(2011, 8, 23, 16, 0, 53, 523144))¶

Returns the utcoffset between the localtime and utctime parameters. If the default parameters are left alone, the result will be the utcoffset of the computer’s time zone.

framework.util.location_cap(location)[source]¶

Appropriately set the caplitalization of the the location. ie. forT collins, co, usa becomes Fort Collins, CO, USA

framework.util.makeUrlAbsolute(url)[source]¶

NOTE: The use case is unclear to me.

framework.util.nl2br(s)[source]¶
Convert all newlines (

) to <br /> tags.

framework.util.normalize(num, min, max)[source]¶

Normalize the given num argument for the given max and min.

framework.util.obfuscate(id, length=12)[source]¶

Appends alpha characters to the given integer id until it is the specified character length (defaults to 12), then base 64 encodes the string and returns it.

framework.util.parse_tags(tagstring)[source]¶

Parses out a list of tags from the given delimited tag string.

framework.util.pluralize(value, arg='s')[source]¶

Returns a plural suffix if the value is not 1, for ‘1 vote’ vs. ‘2 votes’ By default, ‘s’ is used as a suffix; if an argument is provided, that string is used instead. If the provided argument contains a comma, the text before the comma is used for the singular case.

framework.util.prefix(delim, s)[source]¶

Get the prefix of the given string, split on the given delimiter.

framework.util.random_string(length)[source]¶

Returns a random string, including upper and lower case characters and digits, of the specified length.

framework.util.remove_linebreaks(s)[source]¶

Collapse the given string into a single line, and replace all groups of white space with a single space.

framework.util.safestr(s)[source]¶

Tries to convert an object to a string, handling common edge cases. Also supports iterators by converting all items to strings.

framework.util.safeuni(s)[source]¶

Tries to convert an object to a unicode string, handling common edge cases.

framework.util.save_fake_session(data)[source]¶

Save the session manually from a dict

framework.util.setBit(i, index)[source]¶
framework.util.short_decimal(value)[source]¶

Floors the float value to two decimal places.

framework.util.singlespace(s)[source]¶

Replace all groups of white space with a single space.

framework.util.slugify(value)[source]¶

Converts to lowercase, removes non-alpha chars and converts spaces to hyphens.

framework.util.strNullOrEmpty(s)[source]¶

Is the None, empty, or only stripable white space?

framework.util.strip_html(s)[source]¶

Remove anything between <angle brackets>.

framework.util.suffix(delim, s)[source]¶

Get the suffix of the given string, split on the given delimiter.

framework.util.titlecase(value)[source]¶

Converts a string into titlecase.

framework.util.try_f(f, data, default=None)[source]¶

Try to convert data to a new type using the f function. If the conversion fails, then return default.

framework.util.uniqify(seq)[source]¶

Make a list unique.

framework.util.urlencode(s)[source]¶

Quotes the path section of the URL, using urllib.

framework.util.validateUSPhone(phone)[source]¶

Validates that the given string is a valid US phone number, a number that starts with 2-9 followed by 9 digits. ie. “2124800479” http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_Numbering_Plan

framework.util.validate_email(emailaddress)[source]¶

Validate that the given string is an email address. Returns True when valid, False when invalid.

framework.util.wordcount(s)[source]¶

Counts all of the words in a string.

framework.util.zeropad(value)[source]¶

Zero pad the given single digit number.
